channel.title: What Really Matters (MP3 Version)
channel.description: What Really Matters and VickyandJen.com are brought to you by two moms who have taken "mom networking" beyond the next level. Co-hosts, VIcky and Jen will make an impact on the way you and your family value your time, interviewing a wide variety of guests from professional organizers to chefs, parenting experts to doctors, and television personalities to best-selling authors, all about making life simple so you can enjoy what really matters. Join them as they learn, laugh and grow together. And make every day matter.

image.title: What Really Matters (MP3 Version)
image.description: What Really Matters is the popular show on vickyandjen.com making a powerful impact on the way families value their time. Co-hosts Vicky and Jen help today’s busy families lead a simpler life and stay well informed with their entertaining and educational shows, interviewing leading experts in parenting, health, nutrition, self-care, organization, relationships and more. There is no lecturing, just positive and candid talk, all about simplifying, celebrating life and getting the most from the things that really matter.

channel.itunes:author: Vickyandjen.com
channel.itunes:subtitle: What Really Matters on vickyandjen.com is making a powerful impact on the way families value their time. There is no lecturing, just positive and candid talk, all about simplifying, celebrating life and getting the most from the things that really matter.

Join us as we learn, laugh and grow together. And make every day matter.

item.title: Preserving Family Memories - New Traditions
item.description: Everyone wants quality family togetherness, but in these "busy" times, it seems increasingly harder to achieve. Family expert, Meg Cox, offers quirky, meaningful and even traditional ideas that will provide a sense of home and identity for both parents and kids and help bring the fun back to family life.

item.title: The Big O - Punctuality
item.description: Are you an on-time kind of person? Or are you the always in-a-rush late kind? Either way, there are a lot of good reasons to be punctual and believe it or not, punctuality has a lot to do with organization. Monica Ricci joins us again to talk about our sense of time and how to deal with chronic lateness, whether it's your issue or someone else who keeps you waiting!

item.description: We're having a grown up discussion with Stacy Kaiser who says a grown up is one who knows when to get down to business and when to lighten up; can bounce back from life's little spills while not blaming someone else for the mess; and most importantly, comes equipped with the ability to accelerate through any road block to success and happiness. item.title: Be Green - Water
item.description: The average American lifestyle is fueled by nearly 2,000 gallons of H2O a day. What comes as more of a surprise to many is that only 5% of that runs through toilets, taps and hose at home. The rest (yes, 95%) is hidden in the food you eat, energy you use, products you buy, and services you rely on. Get the real facts, not the watered-down ones, as we talk to Brain Clark Howard, Environmental Editor at National Geographic.
item.author: vicky@vickyandjen.com
item.itunes:author: vickyandjen.com

item.title: Healthy Dog Years
item.description: Our beloved pets don't live nearly long enough do they? That's why we need to optimize their health, step up nutrition and get serious about preventive care. Dr. Ernie Ward shares his "be it, do it, share it" philosophy with us and reveals some surprising facts about dog food, dental care, heart worm and more so our best friends will have many healthy dog years to come.

item.title: Oh Crap! I Haven't Saved for Retirement
item.description: Liz Weston, the most read personal finance columnist on the internet, joins us for an easy-to-understand talk about retirement. Even when you're muttering "Oh, Crap!", Liz offers up saving options that are easily achievable. (Even 25 bucks is enough to get you started!) In addition to retirement saving strategies, we throw in tips for cutting back on weekly expenses, how to avoid living beyond your means and how to save when you're in debt - all in an effort to help you plan for a happy future!

Dr. Bob gives us the perfect dose of information we need to understand vaccines and make an educated decision: the risks, the pros, the myths and much more.

item.title: The Big O - Closets
item.description:
Closets. No one sees them but you, right?  But there's nothing worse than a phone book falling on your head or digging frantically to find that missing glove. This space, no matter how big or small, needs to be functional too. Professional Organizer Monica Ricci and Katie Parsons, Rubbermaid Brand Manager, share their strategies for utilizing closet space to the max!

item.title: Queen Bees and Wannabes
item.description:
Cliques, reputations, “frenemies,” rebellion and bullying are all a part of the “wonderful” world of adolescence.  Listen to Rosalind Wiseman, educator and author of best-selling Queen Bees and Wannabes, for practical advice to recognize your daughter’s place and help her through the struggles she is sure to face.

item.title: Is Screaming the New Spanking?
item.description:
Are your kids “parent deaf” tuning out your ongoing requests and reminders until you raise your voice? Let’s face it, we’ve all screamed at our children at one time or another. Wouldn’t it be great if we could stop the “not listening” in its tracks without ever raising our voices? Amy McCready, founder of Positive Parenting Solutions, shows us how.

item.itunes:subtitle: Are your kids “parent deaf” tuning out your ongoing reminders until you raise your voice? Wouldn’t it be great if we could stop the “not listening” in its tracks without ever raising our voices? Amy McCready of Positive Parenting Solutions, shows us how.
item.itunes:summary: Are your kids “parent deaf” tuning out your ongoing requests and reminders until you raise your voice? Let’s face it, we’ve all screamed at our children at one time or another. Wouldn’t it be great if we could stop the “not listening” in its tracks without ever raising our voices? Amy McCready, founder of Positive Parenting Solutions, shows us how. item.title: The Big O Multi-Purpose
item.description:
Double-Duty. Multi-Purpose. Duplicitous. Two-Fold. Dual. You feel accomplished already, don’t you? On this episode of The Big O, we save you time and money. We talk about making the best use of your stuff by re-purposing common household items and finding new uses for old things. And along the way, you can eliminate clutter and feel more organized!

item.title: Uncommon Parenting
item.description:
We are taking an uncommon look at parenting, making a fundamental change to parent with enlightenment, to do conscious parenting, and to create the UNCOMMON PARENT for the NEW EARTH. Today Thomas dispels myths about discipline, puts an end to unwanted behavior (like whining and hitting), and helps parents empower children and create accountability.

SHOW INDEX #163:
00:30 Intro: Be Uncommon

06:35 Let the Child Be the Teacher
12:02 Choices are Important

18:31 Accountability via a List
23:51 About Thomas Haller
26:30 Should Consequences be Severe?
33:41 Is Discipline Used to Gain Control?
34:51 Five Steps to End Unwanted Behavior
43:10 Closing Comments
44:53 Closing Track: Jay Clifford

item.title: Common Sense Media
item.description:
Do you let ratings and reviews determine your movie and game picks for your kids? Or is it based on your personal preferences? item.title: Cooking With Kids
item.description:
Kids in the kitchen can be a recipe for mess and frustration! But there are oodles of positive reasons to get them in there with us, no matter what age.  We talk about how to involve our families more (the simple way), all while having fun and learning along the way.

item.title: You and the Flu
item.description:
New strains, vaccines, school closings, influenza tests, photos of toddlers kissing pigs, conflicting information and even deaths. It’s enough to make you a worry-wart. That’s why we’re getting the FLU facts straight with Dr. Georgina Peacock from the CDC.

SHOW INDEX #156
00:26 Intro: You and the Flu
01:51 Different Strains of Flu
04:06 Why Animal Names?
06:51 Should I get Diagnosed?
08:09 Rules of Contagious-ness
11:54 About Dr. Georgina Peacock
12:31 Listener: Vaccinations
16:50 Signs of Emergency
18:50 Listener: Why Vaccinate?
22:19 Listener: Mercury in Vaccines
24:47 Listener: Flossing Teeth & Flu Onset
26:25 Can You Over Disinfect?
29:33 Closing Comments

item.title: Simply Cool Pet Finder
item.description:
Betsy Saul is simply cool. As the two-legger behind Petfinder.com, her passion for animals will bring a smile to your face, warm your heart and remind you of the simple things in life. Listen in to hear interesting facts about the start up and success of her site including sweet stories of how Petfinder.com has made a difference in the lives of millions.

item.title: Easy Pediatrics Allergies
item.description:
In another episode of Easy Pediatrics with Dr. Alan Greene, we get the lowdown on allergies of all kinds. Not only do we address FAQ's, we uncover surprising stats and answers surrounding allergies: prevention, food label facts, vaccines, ages affected by them and more.

06:27 Introducing Foods to Kids

15:21 About Dr. Greene
16:30 Listener: Allergens on Food Labels
21:19 Listener: Allergies in Schools
23:35 Listener: Gluten and Dairy Intolerant
29:16 Listener: Allergens in Vaccines
31:44 Closing Comments
33:32 Closing Track: Cause for Concern

item.title: Live Large on a Small Budget
item.description:
Learn simple and quick tips to spend less, save more and live better! Our guest, Linsey Knerl, talks about a frugal lifestyle that can be as much fun as it practical. She proves that little stuff (i.e., ice cube trays, Hulu, cruise control, Craig’s List and hiding the “good” toilet paper) adds up to big savings.

SHOW INDEX #150:
00:24 Intro: Live Large on a Small Budget
01:56 Toilet Paper Issues
05:16 Mysteries of the Mystery Shopper
09:27 Whew-Whee! Cost of Gas
13:50 Never Buy New _____.
19:54 What!? Ice Cubes Trays?
23:56 About the Dealista™
25:49 Doh! You Missed the Sale!
31:04 Be Cable-Free.
37:44 Grocery Store Ploys
43:42 Save 3 Months Salary
49:05 Closing Comments

item.title: Feeding Baby Greene
item.description:
In this episode of Easy Pediatrics, Dr. Alan Greene outlines easy steps we can take to teach our children healthy eating habits that will positively impact their health and development for the rest of their lives. We chat about “nutritional intelligence”, the buzz surrounding “BPA”, green foods and much more.

SHOW INDEX #149:
00:41 Lucky You: Feeding Baby Green Book
01:55 Intro: Feeding Baby Green
02:43 Taste Buds and Imprints
11:02 What is Green Feeding?
14:23 Health Issues Today
15:52 Too Late to Change?
17:59 About Dr. Greene
19:04 Buzz About BPA
22:44 For a Healthy Adulthood
24:42 Nutritional Intelligence
25:59 Listener: Nutritious Pregnancy
29:05 Closing Comments
30:54 Closing Track: Cause for Concern

item.title: Kids Are Worth It
item.description:
Listen in for practical advice on how to use the everyday stuff in family life - chores, mealtime, bedtime and other routines - to create a home environment in which kids can become self-disciplined, responsible, resourceful, resilient human beings. Barbara Coloroso, author of Kids are Worth It, discusses her key points to good parenting.

Show Index #148
00:24 Lucky You: Wear Clean Underwear
02:08 Intro: Kids Are Worth It!
03:09 Create a Positive Home Climate
04:08 Offer Choices to Kids
08:01 Three Types of Parents
11:52 Discipline versus Punishment
20:00 Effective TIME-OUT
22:25 Do You Say "I'm Sorry"?
25:10 Steps in the Discipline Process
31:18 About Barbara Coloroso
32:05 Bribes, Rewards and Threats
36:28 Do Good Because Good is Good to Do
38:50 Six Critical Life Messages
41:13 Fostering Strong Self-Esteem
46:18 Rewards at School
50:47 It Starts in Our Homes
55:48 Closing Comments

item.title: Mindless Eating
item.description:
Did you ever eat the last piece of dried out chocolate cake even though it tasted like chocolate scented cardboard?  Ever finish eating a bag of french fries even though they were cold, limp and soggy? We have.

Dr. Brian Wansink, the author of Mindless Eating: Why We Eat More Than We Think is here to change the way we look at food, and give us the facts we need to easily make smarter, healthier, and more mindful choices at the dinner table, in the supermarket, in restaurants, at the office - even at a vending machine!

SHOW INDEX #147
00:30 Intro: Mindless Eating
02:11 200 Decisions About Food Daily
03:52 Cues that Prompting Us to Eat
08:34 Strategies for Eating Less
13:31 About Dr. Wansink
14:12 Hidden Persuaders: Marketing
18:00 Cost and How Much We Eat
22:42 More Tips for Eating Less
25:24 Dr. Wansink's New Research
25:57 Closing Comments
26:49 Closing Track: Russian Red

item.title: Freeze It
item.description:
Is there a way to have healthy meals for our families EVERY day, even when we don't have the time to spend in the kitchen EVERY day?  You bet there is! Join Tricia, the Once a Month Mom, for meal and freezing tips that will lessen our stress, help us eat healthier and save some money along the way! Her ideas can be used just a little, a lot, as a safety net, or for an entire month of meals!

SHOW INDEX #146:
00:22 Intro: Freeze It!
02:35 Why Freezer Cook?
03:49 How It's Done
10:22 Freezers, Tools and Supplies
19:15 Listener: Those Darn Ice Crystals
21:55 About Once a Month Mom
23:55 Food Safety Tips
26:02 Listener: Defrosting Foods Properly
28:20 What to Freeze and NOT Freeze
34:35 Stuff on Once a Month Mom Site
39:54 Closing Comments
41:12 Closing Track: Our Last Goodbye by Andrew Stein

item.title: Coping with Divorce
item.description:

item.description:

item.title: The Big O Sentimental Clutter
item.description:
Are you a memorabiliac? A big sap collector? A memento-master? Are your shelves covered in “special” knick-knacks? Now come one, don’t get all teary-eyed on us. We’re in the same boat - we love sentimental things just like you - but sometimes it can get out of control! What to keep and what NOT to keep - that is the question. Monica Ricci, The Big O organizer, is here to help us with answers.

item.title: Nutrition Matters - The Nutrition Diva
item.description:
Making healthier choices in your daily routines isn’t as hard as you might think! The Nutrition Diva (aka Monica Reinagel) is with us to share small, but important, ways to upgrade your health. Monica is known for sifting through the science and the silliness, separating fact from fiction, and providing straight-forward information on living fit and eating well.

item.title: Simple Study Skills
item.description:
As we head into a new school year, our guest, Susan Kruger M.Ed. from SOAR Study Skills, talks to us about helping our children, no matter what age, to manage homework and study time. She'll tell us a few things about motivating our students, how to reduce the "last minute syndrome", and how to keep it all organized along the way. Most importantly she'll show us how to teach study skills that promote positive homework experiences.

item.description:

item.title: Ask a Chef Claire Robinson
item.description:
Claire Robinson, host of 5 Ingredient Fix on Food Network, shows us how tasty dishes only need five ingredients (and sometimes less). Her result is healthy, easy and quick meals! Listen in and learn about Claire’s straightforward cooking style. You’ll love how she minimizes fuss and maximizes taste at mealtimes!

item.title: Take a Stand Against Bullying
item.description:
It’s not just kids being kids, it is a learned behavior and one that can be changed. And we need to.
Join us for this important episode on bullying with Naomi Drew, a nationally known expert on conflict resolution and peace-making.
There is research to show that bullying stops when adults and peers get involved so that's what we're talking about today. We will cover strategies and skills to bully-proof our children.
SHOW INDEX #137 00:27 Let's Bully-Proof! 01:51 Is it Just a Phase? 03:43 What is Bullying? 07:54 Calming Strategies 13:15 Signs of a Victim 15:30 Open Doors of Communication 20:25 New Book on Bullying! 25:33 Get Involved at School 28:31 Listener: Solutions for Boys vs Girls 35:45 Build a Strong Inner Core 37:41 Teach them Responsibility 42:46 Closing Comments

item.title: The Big O College Bound
item.description:
Monica Ricci is helping families with a smooth transition into college life. Our expert organizer shares simple and practical ideas of what to take, what to leave, how to make good use of small spaces, and ways to keep organized during the move - and even after. "Professor" Monica covers all the courses including textbooks, laundry, campus safety, computers, helpful products and much more.
SHOW INDEX #136 The Big O: College Bound 00:22 "Be a Guest Host" Contest 01:54 Intro: College Bound 03:06 Know Your Space 05:43 Connect With Roomy 09:30 Pack it RIGHT 14:23 Gotta Have Music! 15:38 Establish Credit 17:46 Mark Your Turf 19:48 Textbook Expenses 23:12 "Be a Guest Host" Contest 25:09 O' Baby Product 31:17 Time-Management at School 36:55 Organizing Small Rooms 45:14 Create Life Routines 47:04 Safety on Campus 50:29 Closing Comments
NEW CONTEST You could be a guest host on The Big O: Organization Series. Join the 3 of us as we help others (and ourselves) to simplify our busy lives!
All you gotta do is share a "Big O story" with us by calling in and leaving a message. Tell us why you love the Big O, how it has helped you, a success story, or why you want to meet Monica. Get creative with it! The most interesting and enthusiastic message will win! Call 513-252-2864 by Tuesday, August 4th, 2009 midnite est to record your contest entry.

item.title: Unplug your Kids
item.description:
Is the news a negative influence on my family? How much should I concern myself with my child’s choice of music? Is my son really addicted to video games?
Dr. David Dutwin answers these questions and many more, by doing something few have ever done in the past: actually review the vast literature of academic research out there on these topics, and then report such research in an interactive and friendly way that all parents can understand. Join us as we discuss some of Dr. Dutwin’s findings!
Show Index #135:
00:28 Lucky You! Contest 01:43 Our Hi-Tech Kids 03:36 Evolution of Unplug Your Kids 06:59 A Message to Parents 10:47 Video Game Violence 20:51 Signs of Addiction 24:33 About Dr. David Dutwin 25:17 Listener: Are Games Less Evil than TV? 30:55 Discussing News with Kids 38:56 Listener: Surfing the Net Alone 43:53 About the Book 47:19 Closing Comments 40:36 Closing Track: Before We Go Down

item.title: Simple Fitness
item.description:
For many of us, it just happens. We look in the mirror and we don’t really look like we used to. Especially for women and especially after having children, it just seems really hard to be "fit" as things shift around on our bodies. So, what do we do?
Today we are going to find out why things are shifting, how we stop it, how we can find more time for exercise and how we can be more successful with our workouts. Kelli Calabrese, America's fitness, nutrionist and lifestyle expert, provides us with some practical answers.
Show Index #126: 00:29 Intro: Simple Fitness 01:46 Shift Happens 07:12 Stimulate Your Metabolism 11:34 Find Time to Exercise 21:39 About Kelli Calabrese 24:20 Listener: Looking for Energy 30:35 Common Workout Mistakes 37:19 Food and Fitness 46:07 Closing Comments 47:35 Closing Track: Good To Be Alive

item.title: Preserving Family Memories - All Those Photos
item.description:
We’re all busy these days and busy people let things pile up - like all those photos sitting in boxes or on the computer! Stacy Julian, also a busy mother of five and founder of Big Picture Scrapbooking shares some very simple ideas on what to do with “all those photos” so we will actually PRESERVE, SHARE and most importantly ENJOY them.

item.title: Exceptional Woman
item.description:

item.title: The Noise Guy Live
item.description:
This funny and noisy show was performed in front of a LIVE audience in our hometown. Charlie Williams (a.k.a. The Noise Guy) entertained us with his captivating stories, original music and unbelievable sounds using ONLY his mouth! We hope you'll enjoy it with your kiddos too!

item.title: Slob Proof
item.description:
If there’s a slob living in your house, tune in! Debbie Wiener, author of Slob Proof, says keeping your home looking good doesn’t have to be a struggle. Debbie will show us how to decorate so our homes stand up to daily LIFE - sticky hands, spills, muddy paws, dirty shoes and more. Join us for realistic and comfortable, yet attractive and stylish, design solutions for homes we can REALLY live in and be proud of.

item.title: Home Inventory
item.description:
Have you got a lot to lose? Would you remember everything you owned if you had a house fire, burglary or other disaster? Probably not. This show is about having a home inventory. Whether it is on paper or the computer, there are things you need to know to justify your losses and protect the things that are important to you. Jamie Novak, professional organizer, best-selling author and Collectify’s Chief Organizing Officer shows us how!
Visit VickyandJen.com for more of What Really Matters!

item.title: Chic Mama Beauty
item.description:
Once we become moms, we often become defined and consumed by that role. In the words of our guest today, we lose sight of our inner beauty as a woman. In part two of this two-part series, we will be chatting about beauty - secrets to applying makeup, selecting colors, facials at home and taming those unruly eyebrows!

item.description:
Do you want to give your children a boost in education? Is it a challenge to find the time for extra activities in your daily routine? Do you have a hard time finding inexpensive and easy activities? item.title: Why Gender Matters
item.description:
Forget everything you think you know about gender differences in children. Forget "boys are competitive, girls are collaborative." In recent years, scientists have discovered that differences between girls and boys are more profound than anybody guessed.
Today we’ll discuss those differences with Dr. Leonard Sax, author of Why Gender Matters: What Parents and Teachers Need to Know about the Emerging Science of Sex Differences.
Visit VickyandJen.com for more of What Really Matters!

item.title: Mommy Calls
item.description:
Dr. Tanya Altmann answers some of parents’ most frequently asked questions about babies and toddlers. Her practical, no-nonsense advice guides us through those stressful parenting moments when we want to know “Should I call my doctor?” We chat about tantrums, tummy aches, fevers, poop, breast feeding and other snotty and serious stuff!

item.title: Modern Manners
item.description:
Are you behaving yourself these days? Lizzie Post, from the Emily Post Institute, is joining us to make sure! She’s helping to make the world a better place - one manner at a time - by sharing her etiquette advice. Lizzie suggests ways to handle offensive jokes, tipping at restaurants, overdue thank you cards and more.

item.title: Pink Ribbons
item.description:
Dr. Marisa Weiss, from BreastCancer.org, teaches us how to “take care of our girls” as we explore the facts and fiction related to breast cancer. We discuss risk factors, mammograms, self-exams and how to reduce your chances of developing breast cancer. Listen in and support Breast Cancer Awareness Month now and every month of the year.
Visit VickyandJen.com for more of What Really Matters!

item.title: Parents Guide to Pediatric Visits
item.description:
In this episode of Easy Pediatrics, Dr. Gwenn O’Keeffe shows us how we can make the most of our pediatrician visits with tips for being prepared, communicating with our doctor and having a positive experience. Find out what pediatricians wished parents would do differently, how to deal with doctor jargon, when to use the internet for medical concerns and more. These are true confessions from a pediatrician that you don’t want to miss!

item.title: Wear Clean Underwear
item.description:
“What would you do if you were in an accident? Who would take care of your kids?” asks Alexis Martin Neely, the author of Wear Clean Underwear! A Fast, Fun, Friendly-and Essential-Guide to Legal Planning for Busy Parents. Alexis shares simple steps to make a plan to protect your family and offers free resources. Even better, she offers our listeners a huge bonus! Don’t miss the most important show yet!

item.title: The Big O - Myths and Mistakes
item.description:
It is possible to over-organize. (Myth or Fact?) I am too busy to organize. (Myth or Fact?) Getting organized is expensive. (Myth or Fact?) Find out these answers and more on the latest episode of The Big O: Organization with Monica Ricci. Monica shares the top 5 myths related to organizing as well as the top 5 mistakes people often make when it comes to getting their lives in order.

item.title: Kids and Drugs
item.description:
Kids and Drugs: Addiction Proof Your Child This show is for parents who want to make a difference in their children’s lives - even if your child has never experimented with alcohol or drugs. Internationally recognized addiction expert Stanton Peele shares his realistic approach to preventing drug, alcohol, and other dependencies as we discuss his book Addiction-Proof Your Child.

item.title: Simple Self Care
item.description:
Taking care of ourselves should be a “common sense thing”, but is it? On this show, Simple Self Care, we chat with Karly Randolph Pitman, founder of FirstOurselves.com and a mother who spent years as a “Mommy Martyr”, wanting to be perfect. She reveals six secrets for self-care that we can all work into our daily lives to be happier, healthier and more balanced.
Visit VickyandJen.com for more of "What Really Matters"!

item.title: The Big O Travel
item.description:

item.title: Elder Care Made Easier
item.description:
This show is for anyone who is caring for an aging loved one now, or later. Doctor Marion, author of “Elder Care Made Easier”, shares information from her 10 step elder care plan - written for everyday people. By implementing just one or two of her steps, you will feel more at ease and better prepared for elder care challenges.

item.title: The Big O - Balance in the Basement
item.description:
If your basement reminds you of a scene from a horror movie, then it’s time to get it cleaned up! In this episode of The Big O: Organization with Monica Ricci, we learn simple strategies to maximize space (and make better use of it) in this often “forgotten” area of your home. If you don’t have a basement, all of Monica’s organizing principles can be applied to your garage or attic.

item.title: Moving Made Simple
item.description:
Will you soon be surrounded by cardboard boxes, sticky tape and bubble wrap? Sooner or later, we all have to make a move. Whether it’s across the country or across the street, it can be stressful without the proper planning. Donna Kozik and Tara Maras, authors of 29 Days to a Smooth Move, are here to show us that relocating doesn’t need to be chaotic.

item.title: The Book of No
item.description:
Why is saying “No” so difficult? Best-selling author, Dr. Susan Newman explains why and tells us how we can use the “No” word to avoid feeling overcommitted, stressed and guilty when we refuse someone. Join us as we say “Yes” to Dr. Newman’s simple techniques and discuss The Book of No 250 Ways to Say It and Mean It and Stop People-Pleasing Forever.
Visit VickyandJen.com for more of What Really Matters!
WANT MORE? Did you know that every podcast has a supporting companion page of resources? Go to our site, click on any show title (under the purple podcast tab) for related articles, books, websites, photos and more!

item.title: When to Medicate
item.description:
Like many parents, you may be confused about WHEN to medicate and HOW to medicate. Dr. Gwenn Schurgin O’Keefe, pediatrician and the founder of Pediatrics Now, is on call to help answer our questions about fevers, ear infections, antibiotics, cold and cough medications and more. Tune in now and be more prepared the next time you play nurse for your loved ones, including yourself!

item.title: Making Peace With Your Body
item.description:
How do we begin to make peace with our bodies? What is the dangerous language of fat? How does having a positive body image effect all other aspects of our lives? How can we break the cycle of body loathing? Find out the answers to these and more as we speak with best-selling author, advice columnist and self-esteem expert Jessica Weiner.

item.title: If Mama Aint Happy
item.description: Do you believe a 'good' mother should sacrifice for her children? Kelly Nault, says this is the worst thing you can do. She is founder of UltimateParent.com and is here today to discuss TAKING CARE OF YOU FIRST! If you are a parent, know a parent or have ever had a parent you'll want to listen in for suggestions that may surprise you!

item.title: No Contest - Alfie Kohn
item.description: Board games, sports, spelling bees and even informal contests at home can be damaging to self-esteem, poisonous to relationships and counterproductive in terms of learning. Alfie Kohn tells us why he believes this is true and how we can make a difference by teaching our children to help each other to succeed rather than competing to win.

item.title: Preserving Family Memories Get Together
item.description: They can be small and simple, or large and lavish, but the important thing is that they bring families closer together. item.title: Reading Matters
item.description: You don't have to be an expert to experience the joy of reading with your children! It is so simple, so important and can be your most rewarding memories. Find out how you can easily enrich your child's life with books and simple learning activities at home. Join us for a special live recording of “What Really Matters” with Vicky and Jen. We talk with Brenda Hieronymous, author of "Get Ready to Read" and discuss the benefits of reading to children. We learn simple ways to make it a part of every day, starting today!
item.itunes:author: VickyandJen.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Learn simple ways to make reading a part of every day. The importance plays out in a myriad of developmental, emotional, and learning issues from bonding and security . . . to learning to read . . . to future success.

item.title: Child Care You Can Count On
item.description: Family child care is child care provided in the caregiver's home, rather in a child care center or the child's home. It is the most widely used type of out-of-home care for young children in the United States. Family child care has unique characteristics that make it the preferred option of many parents. Today we’re interviewing Gwen Ridley, a highly respected family child care provider of 19 years.
item.itunes:author: vickyandjen.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Family child care has many unique characteristics that make it a preferred option of many parents. Listen in as we talk with Gwen Ridley, a highly respected provider of 19 years, about the pros and cons of in-home care.

item.title: Last Child in the Woods
item.description: Today’s kids are spending six hours a day in front of a TV, computer, or video game and missing out on essential free play in nature The growing disconnect between children and the outdoors, labeled Nature-Deficit Disorder, has potential negative impacts on a child’s physical, emotional and mental development. Join Vicky and Jens discussion as we interview Richard Louv and learn how to overcome this epidemic that is sweeping the country!
item.itunes:author: vickyandjen.com
item.itunes:subtitle: As technology advances, children are becoming more and more disconnected from nature. Join Vicky and Jens discussion with Richard Louv and learn how to overcome this epidemic of “Nature-Deficit Disorder”.

item.title: Stay Cool and Get Along
item.description: Conflict is a part of being human. It’s normal and natural, and unfortunately the main cause of violence in our school, homes and the world. Join us for this important episode with Naomi Drew, a nationally known expert on conflict resolution and peacemaking. We will talk about strategies and skills for children and adults to resolve conflict and defuse tough situations and discuss her book The Kid’s Guide to Working Out Conflicts.

item.title: Life Coach
item.description: Parenting today is complex. Parents often lead hectic lives and are burdened by feelings of inadequacy, guilt, and anxiety. It is not uncommon for them to feel as if they are just "getting through" everyday life…trudging through duties, only to start over tomorrow. However, today's savvy parents are realizing that they have a tool at their fingertips that will help them get beyond survival to really living - parent coaching. Listen in for more!
item.itunes:author: vickyandjen.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Today we are talking about parent life coaching, the newest way that overstretched parents can get support today. Our guest is Natalee Ziebro, a Life Coach specializing in advice for mothers and wives.

item.title: Long Live the Library
item.description: Long gone are the days of the card catalog and library visits for information. For many of us, the library helped shape us as individuals in the ways we research, explore and develop our curiosities. We have the world literally at our fingertips today, so what is the relevance of the library in this information age? We will explore public library development and the programs being developed to bring value to the library experience for all members of any community.

item.title: 6 Point Plan John Rosemond
item.description: Vicky and Jen interview John Rosemond. A renowned and respected family psychologist, John blames child-centered parenting books from recent decades for creating a generation of dependent, often defiant children. He sets the record straight in The New Six-Point Plan for Raising Happy, Healthy Children, an updated version of his highly successful book published more than fifteen years ago. Today we talk about his "Six-Points".

item.itunes:subtitle: Vicky and Jen interview John Rosemond, America's most widely-read parenting authority! We'll talk about his book, The New Six-Point Plan for Raising Happy, Healthy Children and his common sense approach to parenting.

Do away with big bills, stress, guilt, and exhaustion of holiday preparations and challenge yourself to make the holidays less stressful and more meaningful.

item.title: Preserving Family Memories Pt.1
item.description:
Life isn’t like it used to be, and we need to invent new traditions for today’s families. Meg Cox guides you through the simple steps that help families fully cherish all of those special moments and milestones, help heal the wounds of trauma and loss, and strengthen that indomitable spirit of identity within a family. With the book The Book of New Family Traditions, your family can create the kind of celebrations that lead to everlasting happy memories.

Visit http://www.megcox.com to find out more about Meg.

item.itunes:author: Vicky and Jen
item.itunes:subtitle: Isn’t it the memories we create each day with our loved ones that really matter? We are creating special memories every second and this podcast series is all about capturing them in unique ways so they will live on forever.
item.itunes:summary:
Life isn’t like it used to be, and we need to invent new traditions for today’s families. Meg Cox guides you through the simple steps that help families fully cherish all of those special moments and milestones, help heal the wounds of trauma and loss, and strengthen that indomitable spirit of identity within a family. With the book The Book of New Family Traditions, your family can create the kind of celebrations that lead to everlasting happy memories.

Visit http://www.megcox.com to find out more about Meg.

item.description: the Simpler Family shows families how to make their dreams come true by making smart choices about the way they spend their time and money. Its proven, real-life strategies help families increase their free time together.

item.title: Simple Safety Series-ER
item.description: In our world today, the focus of families and caregivers is on safety in and out of the house. Join our discussion as we learn how to teach not only ourselves, but your children and grandchildren how to handle the hazards in today’s complex world. Topics will include first aid, preventing injuries, child proofing your home, car seats, contact sports and more.
